initial_story:
The baby suffered a cardiac arrest at the theme park on Thursday

A woman has been arrested on suspicion of neglecting a five-month-old boy who suffered a cardiac arrest at a theme park.

The baby is in a critical condition in hospital following the incident at Legoland Windsor at about 13:00 BST on Thursday, police said.

A 27-year-old woman from Witham, Essex, was arrested on suspicion of neglecting a child to cause unnecessary injury.

She has been released on bail until 26 July.

Det Con Zoe Eele, of Thames Valley Police's Child Abuse Investigation Unit, said: "Firstly, our thoughts are with the family of the boy who is in a critical condition in hospital after suffering a cardiac arrest.

"We are working closely with the team at Legoland Windsor Resort but would like to speak to anyone who have information about this incident, specifically anyone who was queueing for the Coastguard HQ boat ride between around 11.30am and 12:45pm.

"I would ask for the public to please avoid speculation about the incident and to respect the boy's family at this deeply upsetting time."

Police said they are not looking for further suspects in relation to the incident.

In a statement, the theme park said: "On Thursday, a young guest was taken ill... and our fully trained First Aid team administered immediate care until the emergency services arrived.

"We will continue to support Thames Valley Police with their ongoing investigation."

Follow BBC South on Facebook, X, or Instagram. Send your story ideas to south.newsonline@bbc.co.uk or via WhatsApp on 0808 100 2240.

The BBC is not responsible for the content of external sites.

The tale of the two bunnies who loved to eat carrots is a heartwarming tale of friendship and love. It all began on a sunny afternoon in the spring, when two bunnies named Daisy and Bella were out exploring the fields. As they hopped along, they came across a large patch of carrots, and they couldn't resist the temptation to take a bite.

As they munched on the carrots, they noticed something strange. The carrots were glowing with a soft, warm light, and they seemed to be alive. Daisy and Bella were amazed and intrigued by the carrots, and they decided to take them home to their burrow.

Once they were back in their home, they set the carrots down and watched in awe as they began to grow and change. The carrots grew taller and taller, until they were as tall as Daisy and Bella themselves. And as they grew, they began to talk and sing.

The carrots told Daisy and Bella about their magical properties. They said that they could grant any wish that a person desired, as long as it was for the good of all. Daisy and Bella were amazed and excited by this news, and they knew that they had to share this secret with the world.

So, Daisy and Bella set out on a journey to spread the word about the magic carrots. They traveled far and wide, sharing their story with anyone who would listen. And as they did, they noticed that the world seemed to be changing. People were becoming kinder and more loving, and the world seemed to be a brighter, more beautiful place.

Daisy and Bella knew that the magic carrots were responsible for this change, and they were proud to have been a part of it. They continued to spread the word about the carrots, and as they did, they realized that their own lives were changing as well. They were becoming happier and more fulfilled, and they knew that they had found their true purpose in life.

The tale of the two bunnies who loved to eat carrots is a heartwarming story of friendship, love, and the power of magic. It is a reminder that even the smallest acts of kindness and love can have a profound impact on the world, and that we all have the power to make a difference.

Daisy couldn't resist the urge to take a bite of the carrots. As soon as she did, she felt a surge of energy and happiness wash over her. She felt more alive and more connected to the world around her than ever before. Daisy knew that these carrots were something special, and she wanted to share them with the world.

So, she set out on a journey to spread the word about the magic of these carrots. She visited villages, towns, and cities, telling everyone she met about the power of the magical carrots. As she traveled, she noticed that the world seemed to be changing. People were becoming kinder and more compassionate, and the world seemed to be a brighter, more beautiful place.

Daisy knew that she had found her true purpose in life. She was spreading love and kindness through the world, one carrot at a time. As she continued her journey, she encountered other creatures who had also been touched by the magic of the carrots. Together, they formed a community of love and happiness, spreading joy wherever they went.

The story of Daisy and the magic carrots is a heartwarming tale of love, friendship, and the power of kindness. It reminds us that even the smallest acts of love can have a profound impact on the world around us, and that by spreading love and kindness, we can make the world a better place for everyone.

It was a dark and stormy night, and the streets were eerily empty. The only sound that could be heard was the steady patter of raindrops on the pavement.

Suddenly, a bright light appeared in the distance, and a strange figure emerged from the shadows. It was a man, dressed all in black, with a long cloak that billowed behind him as he moved. He had a piercing gaze and a sinister smile, and he seemed to be looking for something.

As he walked down the street, the man's eyes darted back and forth, scanning every corner and alleyway. He was searching for something, but it was unclear what it was.

Suddenly, the man stopped and turned his head to the left. He had spotted something in the distance, and he quickly made his way towards it.

When he arrived at his destination, the man found what he was looking for: a small wooden box, tucked away in a hidden corner. He picked it up and examined it carefully, his eyes filled with curiosity and excitement.

The man opened the box and peered inside. He gasped in surprise at what he saw. The box was filled with a strange and glowing substance, and the man could feel a powerful energy emanating from it.

He knew that he had stumbled upon something special, and he was eager to learn more. He quickly closed the box and tucked it away in his cloak, ready to take it home and study it further.

As he made his way back through the empty streets, the man couldn't help but wonder what the strange substance in the box was. He was determined to find out, and he knew that his journey had only just begun.

The sun had set, and the city was shrouded in darkness. The only sound was the occasional gust of wind, and the only light came from the streetlamps that dotted the streets.

I was walking home from work, my mind filled with thoughts of the day. Suddenly, I noticed a figure in the distance, standing in the shadows.

I quickened my pace, my heart pounding in my chest. As I approached, the figure stepped forward, and I saw that it was a woman, dressed in a flowing white gown.

She smiled at me, and her eyes shone with a strange, otherworldly light. I couldn't help but stare at her, transfixed by her beauty and mystery.

"What is your name?" she asked, her voice soft and melodic.

"I'm sorry, I don't know you," I replied, my voice quivering with fear.

"But you do," she said, reaching out to touch my hand. "You just don't remember."

I felt a strange warmth spreading through my body, and I knew that she was right. I did know her, even though I couldn't remember her name.

"What do you want from me?" I asked, my voice shaking with fear.

"I want you to come with me," she said, her eyes never leaving mine. "I have something to show you."

I hesitated for a moment, but something deep within me told me to trust her. I took her hand, and together we walked into the darkness.

The sun had set, and the city was shrouded in darkness. The only sound was the occasional gust of wind, and the only light came from the streetlamps that dotted the streets.

I was walking home from work, my mind filled with thoughts of the day. Suddenly, I noticed a figure in the distance, standing in the shadows.

I quickened my pace, my heart pounding in my chest. As I approached, the figure stepped forward, and I saw that it was a woman, dressed in a flowing white gown.

She smiled at me, and her eyes shone with a strange, otherworldly light. I couldn't help but stare at her, transfixed by her beauty and mystery.

"What is your name?" she asked, her voice soft and melodic.

"I'm sorry, I don't know you," I replied, my voice quivering with fear.

"But you do," she said, reaching out to touch my hand. "You just don't remember."

I felt a strange warmth spreading through my body, and I knew that she was right. I did know her, even though I couldn't remember her name.

"What do you want from me?" I asked, my voice shaking with fear.

"I want you to come with me," she said, her eyes never leaving mine. "I have something to show you."

I hesitated for a moment, but something deep within me told me to trust her. I took her hand, and together we walked into the darkness.

I had no idea where we were going, but I didn't care. I felt a sense of peace and calm washing over me, and I knew that whatever she had to show me was important.

We walked for what felt like hours, the streets growing darker and more desolate as we went. Finally, we came to a small house on the outskirts of town.

"This is where I live," she said, leading me inside. "Please, come in."

I followed her into the house, my eyes wide with wonder. The walls were covered in strange symbols and runes, and the air was thick with the scent of incense.

"What is this place?" I asked, my voice barely a whisper.

"This is my home," she said, turning to face me. "And this is where I will teach you the ways of magic."

I stared at her in disbelief. Magic? Could such a thing really exist?

"Yes," she said, as if reading my thoughts. "Magic is real, and I will teach you how to harness its power."

I stood there, unsure of what to do. But something deep within me told me to stay, to learn what she had to teach me.

And so I did.

For weeks, I studied under her tutelage, learning the secrets of magic and the arcane. And with each passing day, I grew stronger and more powerful.

Finally, the day came when I was ready to test my skills. She led me to a small clearing in the woods, where a pentagram had been carved into the ground.

"This is your final test," she said, her voice calm and steady. "If you pass, you will become a full-fledged magician. If you fail, you will never be able to use magic again."

I nodded, my heart racing in my chest. I knew what I had to do.

I stepped into the pentagram, my eyes closed and my mind focused. And then, with a flash of light and a burst of energy, I felt the power of magic coursing through my veins.

I had passed the test. I was a magician.

And I owed it all to her.

"It was a beautiful day in the city. The sun was shining bright, and the air was warm. I was walking down the street, minding my own business, when I noticed a group of people gathered around a small shop. Curious, I went over to see what the fuss was about.

As I got closer, I realized that the shop was a bakery. It was a charming little place, with a bright red sign and a display case full of delicious-looking pastries. I had never been to this bakery before, but I was definitely intrigued.

I walked up to the counter and ordered a cup of coffee and a pastry. The barista was friendly and welcoming, and she even offered me a free sample of one of the pastries. I was impressed by the quality of the food and the service, and I knew that I had to come back.

Over the next few weeks, I became a regular at the bakery. I tried all of the different pastries, and I even started to learn the names of the other customers. I was starting to feel like part of the community, and I was happy to be a part of it.

One day, I was at the bakery, enjoying my usual coffee and pastry, when I noticed a woman sitting at a table by herself. She was beautiful, with long brown hair and a warm smile. I couldn't help but feel drawn to her, and I knew that I had to introduce myself.

I walked over to her table and asked if I could join her. She smiled and said yes, and we started chatting. It turned out that she was new to the city, and she was also a regular at the bakery. We had a lot in common, and we quickly became friends.

As we got to know each other, I realized that she was much more than just a friend. She was a mentor, a confidant, and a teacher. She taught me about life, love, and happiness, and she helped me to become a better person.

One day, I was at the bakery, enjoying my usual coffee and pastry, when I realized that I was in love with her. I had never felt this way before, and I knew that I had to tell her.

I walked over to her table and took a deep breath. I told her how I felt, and she smiled and said that she felt the same way. We kissed, and it was the most beautiful moment of my life.

From that day on, we were inseparable. We spent every day together, laughing, talking, and just enjoying each other's company. We were happy, and we knew that we were meant to be together.

But then, one day, she was gone. I went to the bakery, expecting to see her there, but she was nowhere to be found. I was heartbroken, and I didn't know what to do.

I searched everywhere for her, but I couldn't find her. I was devastated, and I didn't know how to go on. But then, one day, I realized that she was still with me.

She was the love of my life, and she would always be with me, no matter what. I knew that I had to keep going, to keep living my life, and to keep following my dreams.

And so, I did. I kept going, and I kept living my life. I never forgot her, but I knew that I had to move on.

And that's how it all started. I found love, I lost it, and I learned to live with it. I still go to the bakery, and I still think of her every day. But I know that she's always with me, in my heart, and that's enough for me."

I was sitting in my office, minding my own business, when I received a strange text message. It said, "Hey, you should check out this new bakery that just opened up in town. The pastries are out of this world!"

I was intrigued, so I decided to head over and see what all the fuss was about. As soon as I stepped inside, I was greeted by a warm, inviting atmosphere and the smell of freshly baked goods. I knew I had to try something, so I ordered a cup of coffee and a pastry.

As I took my first bite, I was transported to a world of pure bliss. The pastry was soft, fluffy, and filled with a delicious custard-like filling. The coffee was rich and flavorful, and it paired perfectly with the pastry.

I couldn't help but smile as I took another bite. I had never tasted anything quite like it before. I felt like I was in a dream, and I never wanted to wake up.

As I continued to indulge in the pastry, I noticed a couple sitting at a table nearby. They seemed to be deep in conversation, and they were laughing and smiling. I couldn't help but wonder what they were talking about.

I decided to walk over and ask them. "Excuse me," I said, "but I couldn't help but notice that you two seem to be enjoying yourselves. Would you mind sharing what you're talking about?"

The couple looked up at me and smiled. "Well, we're actually on our first date," the man said.

"That's great!" I said. "I hope it's going well."

"Oh, it is," the woman said. "We've been talking for hours, and we just can't get enough of each other."

I smiled and wished them luck, then headed back to my table. As I sat there, enjoying the rest of my pastry and coffee, I couldn't help but feel a sense of hope. Maybe one day, I thought, I'll find someone who makes me feel the way that couple does.

And then, as if on cue, a beautiful woman walked in and sat down at the table next to mine. She looked up and smiled at me, and I felt my heart skip a beat.

"Hi," she said. "I couldn't help but notice that you seem to be enjoying your pastry. Would you mind if I had a bite?"

I smiled and handed her a piece. "Of course," I said. "It's delicious, isn't it?"

She took a bite and closed her eyes. "It's heavenly," she said. "I've never tasted anything like it before."

We sat there, talking and laughing, and before I knew it, it was time for me to go. "I'm sorry to leave so soon," I said, "but I have to get back to work. Maybe I'll see you again soon?"

The woman smiled and nodded. "I hope so," she said. "It was nice meeting you."

As I walked out of the bakery, I felt a sense of contentment wash over me. I had found something truly special, and I knew that it would stay with me for the rest of my life.

And then, as if by magic, I stumbled upon a bakery that offered the most delicious and decadent pastries I had ever tasted. The pastries were so good that I couldn't help but smile as I took my first bite.

I had never tasted anything quite like it before. It was heavenly, and I never wanted to wake up from the dream. The pastry was soft, fluffy, and filled with a delicious custard-like filling. The coffee was rich and flavorful, and it paired perfectly with the pastry.

As I continued to indulge in the pastry, I noticed a couple sitting at a table nearby. They seemed to be deep in conversation, and they were laughing and smiling. I couldn't help but wonder what they were talking about.

I decided to walk over and ask them. "Excuse me," I said, "but I couldn't help but notice that you two seem to be enjoying yourselves. Would you mind sharing what you're talking about?"

The couple looked up at me and smiled. "Well, we're actually on our first date," the man said.

"That's great!" I said. "I hope it's going well."

"Oh, it is," the woman said. "We've been talking for hours, and we just can't get enough of each other."

I smiled and wished them luck, then headed back to my table. As I sat there, enjoying the rest of my pastry and coffee, I couldn't help but feel a sense of hope. Maybe one day, I thought, I'll find someone who makes me feel the way that couple does.

The warm glow of the fireplace cast a soft light on the cozy living room. It was a perfect evening for a romantic movie night with my partner.

I reached for the remote and turned on the TV, eager to find the perfect movie to set the mood. As I scrolled through the options, my partner's hand brushed against mine, sending a shiver down my spine.

"How about this one?" I said, pointing to a classic romance.

My partner nodded in agreement, and we snuggled up on the couch, ready to be swept away by the romance on the screen.

As the movie began, I felt my partner's arm wrap around me, pulling me closer. The warmth of their body against mine was intoxicating, and I couldn't resist the urge to lean in for a kiss.

Our lips met, and a wave of passion washed over us. We pulled away for a moment, both breathless and smiling, before diving back in for another kiss.

The movie faded into the background as we lost ourselves in the moment. We explored every inch of each other's bodies, our hands roaming and caressing, our lips locked in a passionate embrace.

The fire crackled in the background, adding to the romantic atmosphere. The smell of popcorn filled the air, making it feel like a night out at the movies, but better.

We were so caught up in each other that we didn't even notice when the movie ended. We finally pulled away from each other, both flushed and breathless, and smiled at each other.

"That was amazing," my partner whispered, their eyes shining with love.

"I couldn't agree more," I said, my heart full.

We snuggled back up on the couch, content to just be in each other's arms, and fell asleep, dreaming of our next romantic adventure together.

The room was dark, lit only by the flickering candles. The air was thick with anticipation, and the scent of jasmine filled the room.

She walked in, her dress flowing behind her like a cloud. He stood, his heart pounding in his chest, and pulled her close.

Their lips met, and a spark ignited between them. Their bodies pressed together, and the heat of the moment was overwhelming.

They moved to the bed, and the world around them faded away. All that mattered was the two of them, lost in each other's embrace.

Their hands explored, their lips tasted, and their hearts beat in unison. They were one, and the intensity of their passion was undeniable.

As the night wore on, they were lost in each other, consumed by their love. They were the only two in the world, and nothing else mattered.

They fell asleep, their bodies tangled together, their hearts full of love. And in the morning, they awoke to a new day, and a new love that would last a lifetime.
